title: Question 5
prompt:
Sentence 9: Does not explain the reasons for your resignation or disclose any information about your new position.

Which is the best way to write the underlined portion of this sentence? If the original is the best way, choose option (A).
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
Sentence 6 is an imperative. The writer is giving the reader a directive, or telling the reader to do something. In an imperative sentence, the subject is implied, or unstated. The unstated subject is always “you,” the person being spoken to. The verb needs to match the implied subject. “You does” is not correct. “You do” is correct.


[You] Do not explain the reasons for your resignation or disclose any information about your new position.
